title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Reflected in GitHub repository microweber/microweber 1.3.4 and prior. A patch is available and anticipated to be part of the 2.x branch.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5244
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/commit/1cb846f8f54ff6f5c668f3ae64dd81740a7e8968
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/a3bd58ba-ca59-4cba-85d1-799f73a76470
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rgf9-j7gv-rq22
items.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
The commit 3730880 (April 2023) and v.0.9-beta1 of gugoan Economizzer has a user enumeration vulnerability in the login and forgot password functionalities. The app reacts differently when a user or email address is valid, and when it's not. This may allow an attacker to determine whether a user or email address is valid, or brute force valid usernames and email addresses.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38871
  • https://github.com/dub-flow/vulnerability-research/tree/main/CVE-2023-38871
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer
  • https://www.economizzer.org
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/commit/37308802dfe00d43df396a8afaa2096ece8b7b57
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h3qf-v68r-35jg
items.title: [gugoan/economizzer] Economizzer user enumeration vulnerability

items.content_html:
An Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability in gugoan Economizzer commit 3730880 (April 2023) and v.0.9-beta1 allows any unauthenticated attacker to access cash book entry attachments of any other user, if they know the Id of the attachment.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38872
  • https://github.com/dub-flow/vulnerability-research/tree/main/CVE-2023-38872
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer
  • https://www.economizzer.org
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/commit/37308802dfe00d43df396a8afaa2096ece8b7b57
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-896v-ph5w-379h
items.title: [gugoan/economizzer] Economizzer Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability

items.content_html:
A remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability via an insecure file upload exists in gugoan's Economizzer v.0.9-beta1 and commit 3730880 (April 2023). A malicious attacker can upload a PHP web shell as an attachment when adding a new cash book entry. Afterwards, the attacker may visit the web shell and execute arbitrary commands.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38874
  • https://github.com/dub-flow/vulnerability-research/tree/main/CVE-2023-38874
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer
  • https://www.economizzer.org
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/commit/37308802dfe00d43df396a8afaa2096ece8b7b57
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pq98-6hf6-3rj3
items.title: [gugoan/economizzer] Economizzer remote code execution vulnerability

items.content_html:
The commit 3730880 (April 2023) and v.0.9-beta1 of gugoan Economizzer is vulnerable to Clickjacking. Clickjacking, also known as a "UI redress attack", is when an attacker uses multiple transparent or opaque layers to trick a user into clicking on a button or link on another page when they were intending to click on the top-level page. Thus, the attacker is "hijacking" clicks meant for their page and routing them to another page, most likely owned by another application, domain, or both.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38873
  • https://github.com/dub-flow/vulnerability-research/tree/main/CVE-2023-38873
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer
  • https://www.economizzer.org
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/commit/37308802dfe00d43df396a8afaa2096ece8b7b57
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gc95-5mmp-mp6j
items.title: [gugoan/economizzer] Economizzer vulnerable to Clickjacking

items.content_html:
A host header injection vulnerability exists in gugoan's Economizzer v.0.9-beta1 and commit 3730880 (April 2023). By sending a specially crafted host header in the reset password request, it is possible to send password reset links to users which, once clicked, lead to an attacker-controlled server and thus leak the password reset token. This allows an attacker to reset other users' passwords.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38877
  • https://github.com/dub-flow/vulnerability-research/tree/main/CVE-2023-38877
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/
  • https://www.economizzer.org
  • https://github.com/gugoan/economizzer/commit/37308802dfe00d43df396a8afaa2096ece8b7b57
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqp9-mrjw-7qq2
items.title: [gugoan/economizzer] Economizzer host header injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
Impact

Any module can be disabled or uninstalled from back office, even with low user right.

Patches

8.1.2

Workarounds

none

References

References

  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/security/advisories/GHSA-6jmf-2pfc-q9m7
  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/commit/ce1f67083537194e974caf86c57e547a0aaa46cd
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6jmf-2pfc-q9m7
items.title: [prestashop/prestashop] PrestaShop allows users to uninstall modules from backoffice, even with low rights

items.content_html:
Impact

In BO, an employee can list all modules without any access rights: method ajaxProcessGetPossibleHookingListForModule doesn't check access rights

Patches

Fixed on 8.1.2

Workarounds

References

References

  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/security/advisories/GHSA-gvrg-62jp-rf7j
  • https://github.com/PrestaShop/PrestaShop/commit/15bd281c18f032a5134a8d213b44d24829d45762
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gvrg-62jp-rf7j
items.title: [prestashop/prestashop] PrestaShop allows employee without any access rights to list all installed modules

items.content_html:
Introspection is enabled on demo.pimcore.fun. The demo site has graphql as a feature for users, but allows users to run instropection queries, which presents a potential schema information disclosure vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5192
  • https://github.com/pimcore/demo/commit/a2a7ff3b565882aefb759804aac4a51afb458f1f
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/65c954f2-79c3-4672-8846-a3035e7a1db7
  • https://github.com/pimcore/demo/pull/437
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p76j-h4m8-hx5c
items.title: [pimcore/demo] Pimcore Demo Allows GraphQL Introspection

items.content_html:
A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in /panel/configuration/financial/ of Subrion v4.2.1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary web scripts or HTML via a crafted payload injected into several fields: 'Minimum deposit', 'Maximum deposit' and/or 'Maximum balance'.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-43830
  • https://github.com/al3zx/xss_financial_subrion_4.2.1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q832-2275-rfqh
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS XSS in /panel/configuration/financial/

items.content_html:
Path Traversal in OpenCart versions 4.0.0.0 to 4.0.2.2 allows an authenticated user with access/modify privilege on the Log component to empty out arbitrary files on the server

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2315
  • https://github.com/opencart/opencart/commit/0a8dd91e385f70e42795380009fd644224c1bc97
  • https://starlabs.sg/advisories/23/23-2315/
  • https://github.com/opencart/opencart/releases/tag/4.0.2.3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v4j2-cwmm-xg89
items.title: [opencart/opencart] OpenCart Path Traversal vulnerability

items.content_html:
Withdrawn Advisory

This advisory has been withdrawn because the vulnerability does not affect a package in one of the GitHub Advisory Database's supported ecosystems. This link is maintained to preserve external references.

Original Description

In Magento prior to 1.9.4.3 and Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, an authenticated user with limited administrative privileges can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into transactional email page when creating a new email template or editing existing email template.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8228
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-988g-wfwf-5666
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Withdrawn Advisory: Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in moodle 3.7 to 3.7.2 and before 3.7.3, where there is blind XSS reflected in some locations where user email is displayed.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-14881
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-14881
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=393584#p1586746
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/7455b741c954af3c3e7dfda2972edc1146ea1562
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9jf6-wq34-fg9w
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM before 10.0.3 has an Insufficient Filtering issue that can lead to user/card.php XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19211
  • https://herolab.usd.de/en/security-advisories/usd-2019-0053/
  • https://www.dolibarr.org/forum/dolibarr-changelogs
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gfhf-2xr5-2fvw
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM before 10.0.3 allows XSS because uploaded HTML documents are served as text/html despite being renamed to .noexe files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19210
  • https://herolab.usd.de/security-advisories/usd-2019-0052/
  • https://www.dolibarr.org/forum/dolibarr-changelogs
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-87r3-4gc8-f897
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM before 10.0.3 allows SQL Injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19209

  • https://www.dolibarr.org/forum/dolibarr-changelogs
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jh3j-xfv2-f9m9
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM SQLi

items.content_html:
In SilverStripe/GraphQL prior to 2.0.5 and 3.1.2, the previous fix for SS-2018-007 does not completely mitigate the risk of CSRF in GraphQL mutations.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12437
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/cve-2019-12437
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-graphql/commit/3c1dd6b839b7c0e2cbc85074bb5840ebded6097c
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-graphql/commit/db28f3075ae2335905f43ac808e9177497e354ff
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fx37-56v6-85q6
items.title: [silverstripe/graphql] Silverstripe CSRF Protection Bypass via GraphQL

items.content_html:
In SilverStripe/GraphQL prior to 2.0.5 and 3.1.2, the previous fix for SS-2018-007 does not completely mitigate the risk of CSRF in GraphQL mutations.

items.title: [silverstripe/graphql] Silverstripe CSRF Protection Bypass via GraphQL

items.content_html:
Dolibarr CRM/ERP 10.0.3 allows viewimage.php?file= Stored XSS due to JavaScript execution in an SVG image for a profile picture.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19206
  • https://medium.com/@k43p/cve-2019-19206-stored-xss-due-to-javascript-execution-in-an-svg-file-ee1d038fba76
  • https://www.dolibarr.org/forum/dolibarr-changelogs
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f6h3-66xr-hqr2
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A CSRF vulnerability in Pagekit 1.0.17 allows an attacker to upload an arbitrary file by removing the CSRF token from a request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-19013
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155426/Pagekit-CMS-1.0.17-Cross-Site-Request-Forgery.html
  • https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/gemnasium-db/-/commit/fdf885ccf7c57c69f4d256bbb3ec76a927267a2b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-692x-89xv-64jx
items.title: [pagekit/pagekit] Pagekit File Upload vulnerability
